channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole on the left hand side, between Wisteria and Coriander on Innsworth Lane, Churchdown, northbound. Been there for at least 2 weeks, and slowly growing., 30th October
item.description:
Could it be checked and ideally filled please ? Thanks !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: There are at least 5 drains blocked on Gloucester Road Andoversford between Crossfields and Coronation Square, 30th October
item.description:
What three words locations: ///decking.airliners.boom ///blissful.assets.craters ///unfit.person.earmarked ///perfectly.competing.chimp ///euphoric.showcase.overt These drains are full to the brim with silt and need digging out. Rain water floods the road lower down by the Royal Oak because it canâ€™t get into these drains. Only the action of residents pulling up covers lower down prevent properties from flooding

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain is silted up to just below the top of the hole, 30th October
item.description:
What 3 words ///expanded.flitting.cocktail The drain is full of silt and needs to be properly dug out. The rain on Saturday night (28/10) caused flooding lower down the road due to this and other drains not functioning

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yet Another Flytip at Old Quarry Entrance, 30th October
item.description:
The location is the Old Quarry Entrance off Cleeve Common Road. The tip comprises flooring material, cistern and pillows from which foam pieces are escaping. Please can this be cleared up as soon as possible - especially before high winds get at it and disperses the small pieces of foam.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Noverton Lane, Southam, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

Grass verge to the right hand side of village hall car park gates (outside of hall grounds next to pavement).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 30th October
item.description:
email rec (also attached) 28/10/2023 Dear Highways We have been contracted to carry out some tree work at The Woodlands Butts Lane Woodmancote Cheltenham GL52 9QH There are 6 self seeded young trees along the boundary wall on the roadside, 5 x ash with ash dieback, and 1 x field maple. 3 of the trees are causing damage to the building stone work, pushing into the capping stones, and the others are showing signs of dieback. We would like to notify you of their removal. Please can you confirm that you are in agreement. Please see attached photos. Kind Regards
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstructed public right of way, 30th October
item.description:
Overgrown vegetation is preventing access along the public right of way just off The Wharf lane at Coombe Hill so is not safe for public walkers to use. This needs to be cut back as it is currently inaccessible. This was reported in July 2023 and nothing has been done.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Wharf, Leigh, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 30th October
item.description:
A tree roots of a tree adjacent to the property are causing movement underneath the extension. Causing the extension to rotate away from the property. The customer would be happy to replace or plant any tree/trees to replace the one that may need taking down.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: HGV vehicles, 30th October
item.description:
I've had a chat with a few residents about the speed and weight of some of the vehicles coming down Swindon Lane. One resident has told me about the shaking he gets in his house, and that he can see normally over 50 vehicles a day over the current weight restrictions. Could we look at improved signage or liaising with the police to increase enforcement?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Swindon Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
